citation.article-title: Classification of eight new species of ammonia-oxidizing bacteria: Nitrosomonas communis sp. nov., Nitrosomonas ureae sp. nov., Nitrosomonas aestuarii sp. nov., Nitrosomonas marina sp. nov., Nitrosomonas nitrosa sp. nov., Nitrosomonas eutropha sp. nov., Nitrosomonas oligotropha sp. nov. and Nitrosomonas halophila sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nitrosomonas oligotropha sp. nov.
Nitrosomonas oligotropha (o.li.go.tro'pha. Gr. adj. oligos, little; Gr. n. trophos, one who feeds; ML fem. n. oligotropha, little nutrition)
The description is based on six isolates.
Cells rod-shaped with rounded ends or spherical, 0.8-1.2 by 1.1- 2.4 μm in size.
Cell aggregates are present after exponential growth has ceased.
Utilization of urea as ammonia source observed in five of the six strains.
Sensitive to increasing ammonia concentrations > 50 mM.
The G +C content of the DNA is 49.4-50.0 mol% (Tm).
Habitat: common in industrial sewage disposal systems; most of the isolates originate from water samples contaminated with chemicals.
Type strain : Nm 45 - culture collection of the Institut fur Allgemeine Botanik der Universitat Hamburg, Mikrobiologische Abteilung, FRG.
